channel.title: Help Please
channel.description:
I'm not sure if this is a runescape only section (if it is I am sorry) but I'm working on a script for Adventure Quest (yea I know, but my friend wanted one and I was bored). It doesn't need to be fancy because they dont have any macro detectors as far as I know of.
when I run this script I get an error message saying:
Line 23: [Error] (23:1): Identifier expected in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\Scripts\battleon.scar
program New; var x,y,a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h,i,j,k,l:integer; begin repeat MoveMouse(399,469) ClickMouse(399,469,true) wait(750) MoveMouse(230,309) ClickMouse(230,309,true) wait(750) MoveMouse(505,446) ClickMouse(505,447,true) wait(500) MoveMouse(758,622) ClickMouse(758,622,true) wait(5000) MoveMouse(831,685) If FindColor(c,d,10040064,822,351,829,358) then MoveMouse(494,518)//ice ClickMouse(494,518,true) MoveMouse(614,564) ClickMouse(614,564,true) Else If FindColor(e,f,10040064,824,386,829,393) then MoveMouse(494,518)//energy ClickMouse(494,518,true) MoveMouse(601,497) ClickMouse(601,497,true) Else If FindColor(g,h,10040064,824,404,829,410) then MoveMouse(494,518)//light ClickMouse(494,518,true) MoveMouse(639,544) ClickMouse(639,544,true) Else If FindColor(i,j,10040064,825,421,829,427) then MoveMouse(494,518)//dark ClickMouse(494,518,true) MoveMouse(627,522) ClickMouse(627,522,true) Else If FindColor(k,l,10040064,824,371,829,377) then MoveMouse(494,518)//earth ClickMouse(494,518,true) MoveMouse(625,455) ClickMouse(625,455,true) Else MoveMouse(494,518)//fire ClickMouse(494,518,true) MoveMouse(608,483) ClickMouse(608,483,true) repeat MoveMouse(458,426) ClickMouse(458,426,true) wait(500) If FindColor(a,b,213,400,374,602,430) then MoveMouse(500,502) ClickMouse(500,502,true) wait(5000) MoveMouse(418,445) ClickMouse(418,445,true) wait(500) ClickMouse(418,445,true) wait(2000) MoveMouse(399,469) ClickMouse(399,469,true) wait(750) MoveMouse(230,309) ClickMouse(230,309,true) wait(750) MoveMouse(505,446) ClickMouse(505,447,true) wait(500) MoveMouse(758,622) ClickMouse(758,622,true) wait(5000) until(FindColor(x,y,10931946,433,397,560,597)) wait(500) MoveMouse(503,552) ClickMouse(503,552,true) wait(1000) MoveMouse(508,571) ClickMouse(508,571,true) wait(500) MoveMouse(498,456) ClickMouse(498,456,true) wait(4000) until(false) end.
I am a beginner scripter so any help would be greatly appreciated.

item.title: Help Please
item.dc:creator: @Monkmonk693 Monkmonk693
item.description:
@Monkmonk693 wrote:

thanks, I didn’t know that was a command.[br][size=1]Posted at: August 21, 2006, 07:48:59 PM[/size][hr]Can anybody find what’s wrong?[br][size=1]Posted at: August 21, 2006, 09:22:54 PM[/size][hr]This script is driving me insane. The scar tutorial program says that when the error message saying identifier expected message comes up, it means you have to complete all of your blocks. As far as I know, all of my blocks are closed. Any help would be EXTREMELY appreciated.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Please
item.dc:creator: @SuperNewb SuperNewb
item.description:
@SuperNewb wrote:

[scar]procedure Moveclickwait(x,y,waittime:Integer);
begin
movemousesmooth(x,y)
clickmouse(x,y,true)
wait(waittime)
end;[/scar]
this would make things simpler (i think…)

Read full topic

item.title: Help Please
item.dc:creator: @Monkmonk693 Monkmonk693
item.description:
@Monkmonk693 wrote:

I will use that, but that doesnt fix the script.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Please
item.dc:creator: @KyleGut3 KyleGut3
item.description:
@KyleGut3 wrote:

Heres a tip to remove those unnecessary variables… since you arent using them at all. Rmove your declaration line, and then for ever FindColor procedure, replace it with:
[scar]
if(GetColor(x,y) = color)then begin
[/scar
etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Please
item.dc:creator: @Monkmonk693 Monkmonk693
item.description:
@Monkmonk693 wrote:

I’m not sure if this is a runescape only section (if it is I am sorry) but I’m working on a script for Adventure Quest (yea I know, but my friend wanted one and I was bored). It doesn’t need to be fancy because they dont have any macro detectors as far as I know of.

when I run this script I get an error message saying:

Line 23: [Error] (23:1): Identifier expected in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\Scripts\battleon.scar

program New;
var x,y,a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h,i,j,k,l:integer;
begin
repeat
MoveMouse(399,469)
ClickMouse(399,469,true)
wait(750)
MoveMouse(230,309)
ClickMouse(230,309,true)
wait(750)
MoveMouse(505,446)
ClickMouse(505,447,true)
wait(500)
MoveMouse(758,622)
ClickMouse(758,622,true)
wait(5000)
MoveMouse(831,685)
If FindColor(c,d,10040064,822,351,829,358) then
MoveMouse(494,518)//ice
ClickMouse(494,518,true)
MoveMouse(614,564)
ClickMouse(614,564,true)
Else If FindColor(e,f,10040064,824,386,829,393) then
MoveMouse(494,518)//energy
ClickMouse(494,518,true)
MoveMouse(601,497)
ClickMouse(601,497,true)
Else If FindColor(g,h,10040064,824,404,829,410) then
MoveMouse(494,518)//light
ClickMouse(494,518,true)
MoveMouse(639,544)
ClickMouse(639,544,true)
Else If FindColor(i,j,10040064,825,421,829,427) then
MoveMouse(494,518)//dark
ClickMouse(494,518,true)
MoveMouse(627,522)
ClickMouse(627,522,true)
Else If FindColor(k,l,10040064,824,371,829,377) then
MoveMouse(494,518)//earth
ClickMouse(494,518,true)
MoveMouse(625,455)
ClickMouse(625,455,true)
Else
MoveMouse(494,518)//fire
ClickMouse(494,518,true)
MoveMouse(608,483)
ClickMouse(608,483,true)
repeat
MoveMouse(458,426)
ClickMouse(458,426,true)
wait(500)
If FindColor(a,b,213,400,374,602,430) then
MoveMouse(500,502)
ClickMouse(500,502,true)
wait(5000)
MoveMouse(418,445)
ClickMouse(418,445,true)
wait(500)
ClickMouse(418,445,true)
wait(2000)
MoveMouse(399,469)
ClickMouse(399,469,true)
wait(750)
MoveMouse(230,309)
ClickMouse(230,309,true)
wait(750)
MoveMouse(505,446)
ClickMouse(505,447,true)
wait(500)
MoveMouse(758,622)
ClickMouse(758,622,true)
wait(5000)
until(FindColor(x,y,10931946,433,397,560,597))
wait(500)
MoveMouse(503,552)
ClickMouse(503,552,true)
wait(1000)
MoveMouse(508,571)
ClickMouse(508,571,true)
wait(500)
MoveMouse(498,456)
ClickMouse(498,456,true)
wait(4000)
until(false)
end.

I am a beginner scripter so any help would be greatly appreciated.

Read full topic
